com.fuse.ui

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fuse.ui.TouchReceiver
      • com.fuse.ui.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventNode, ImageNode, LambdaNode, LineNode, RectNode, TextNode

    public class Node
extends TouchReceiver
    Base class for scenegraph UI functionality, heavily inspired by the ofxInterface OpenFrameworks addon: https://github.com/galsasson/ofxInterface

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Comparator<Node> bottomPlaneFirst
      Comparator for ordering a list of Nodes from lower plane to higher plane (used for rendering)
      com.fuse.utils.Event<Node> newChildEvent
      Triggered when a -direct- child is added to this node

      Triggered when a child is added to this node, or any of its offspring

      PGraphics instance, accessible to all Node instances (and instances of its inheriting classes)

      com.fuse.utils.Event<Node> sizeChangeEvent 
      static Comparator<Node> topPlaneFirst
      Comparator for ordering a list of Nodes from higher plane to lower plane (used by TouchManager)

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node()
      Default constructor; intializes default value (visible, interactive, empty name, position zero, size zero)
      Node(String nodeName)
      Constructor which initializes default values but lets caller specify the node's name

      void addChild(Node newChildNode) 
      ExtensionBase copyAllTouchEventsFrom(TouchReceiver source)
      Creates an extension that monitors the source for touch events and passed them on to this node These two methods create a circular dependency between Node and TouchEventForwarder, however they merely exist for providing an easy API

      • render

        public void render()
        Render will render this component and its subtree. usually should be called on the root scene object, but can be used also for offline rendering of any branch of the graph render is done as follows: 1. get list of subtree nodes (only visible ones by default) 2. sort by plane value 3. call draw from back to front

      • render

        public void render(boolean forceAll)
        Renders components and subtree, see render() for more info.
        Parameters:
        forceAll - Ignores nodes' visibility flags if true

      • renderDebug

        public void renderDebug()
        same as 'render' methods, but 'drawDebug' is called instead of 'draw' on each node

      • setClipContent

        public void setClipContent(boolean enable)
        When enabled it will set itself as the clipping node (see setClippingNode method) on all its current and future offspring (subtree) nodes.
        Parameters:
        enable - Enables when true, disables when false

      • copyAllTouchEventsFrom

        public ExtensionBase copyAllTouchEventsFrom(TouchReceiver source)
        Creates an extension that monitors the source for touch events and passed them on to this node These two methods create a circular dependency between Node and TouchEventForwarder, however they merely exist for providing an easy API
